intro: Rosularia modesta var. modesta, commonly known as the modest rosebay willowherb, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Onagraceae. It is characterized by its upright, herbaceous growth habit and features showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in moist, sunny habitats such as wet meadows and stream banks. Rosularia modesta var. modesta is often found in temperate regions of Europe and parts of Asia.
